article_title: Jason Collins, the Nets and the 'Who Cares' Crowd
article_text: I am happy for basketball and also for the Brooklyn Nets, the sleek NBA outfit which plays about a six-minute bike ride away from my apartment. Like a lot of people, I have found it hard to possess strong feelings about the Nets. I definitely didn't have strong feelings about them when they played in New Jersey, where they often specialized in being crummy at basketball and scaring away most of their fans. Last season they arrived in Brooklyn, moving into a controversial, neighborhood-altering arena that looked like a turtle sculpture that had been left out in the rain. The Brooklyn version of the Nets has been less...

twitter.description: Saying 'who cares' about something like Jason Collins signing with an NBA team sounds like a socially acceptable way of diminishing the news, stripping Collins of his due and a genuine moment of its joy.
twitter.creator: @jasongay

article_summary:
Like a lot of people, I have found it hard to possess strong feelings about the Nets.
The Brooklyn version of the Nets has been less...
I am happy for basketball and also for the Brooklyn Nets, the sleek NBA outfit which plays about a six-minute bike ride away from my apartment.
I definitely didn't have strong feelings about them when they played in New Jersey, where they often specialized in being crummy at basketball and scaring away most of their fans.
Last season they arrived in Brooklyn, moving into a controversial, neighborhood-altering arena that looked like a turtle sculpture that had been left out in the rain.
